menu.title: Smarter Flair Vents options
menu.description: Choose which settings to configure. Start with DAB & polling, then map thermostats and sensors.

algorithm_settings.title: Algorithm & polling
algorithm_settings.description:
Tune Dynamic Airflow Balancing (DAB) and polling behavior.

- Use DAB: automatically adjusts vents based on room efficiency.
- Force manual: sets the Flair structure to manual when DAB runs.
- Close inactive rooms: closes vents for rooms marked inactive (airflow safety may reopen some vents).
- Granularity: rounds vent changes to reduce frequent adjustments.
- Polling intervals: refresh rates for active vs idle HVAC.
- Initial efficiency: starting % used before learned data exists.
- Notifications/logbook: optionally record efficiency adjustments.
- Control strategy:
  - dab: uses the original airflow curve
  - cost: uses a linear target with movement/open penalties
  - stats: uses a learned linear model per vent
  - hybrid: picks the lowest-cost target from all strategies

data.poll_interval_idle: Polling interval while HVAC is idle (minutes)

data.log_efficiency_changes: Write efficiency adjustments to the logbook
data.temp_error_override_c: Temperature error (C) that overrides hold rules

vent_assignments.title: Vent assignments
vent_assignments.description:
Assign a thermostat and (optionally) a temperature sensor for each vent. Found {vent_count} vents.

- Thermostat: the HVAC system serving that vent.
- Temperature sensor (optional): overrides Flair room temperature for DAB.
- If no sensor is selected, the Flair room temperature (including any Flairâ€‘assigned puck/remote sensor) is used.

conventional_vents.title: Conventional vent counts
conventional_vents.description: Enter how many non-Flair vents exist for each thermostat. This prevents total airflow from dropping too low when DAB closes vents. If unsure, set to 0.
